xxl.io
Class DoubleConverter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.io.Converter
        |
        +--xxl.io.DoubleConverter
public class DoubleConverter
extends Converter

This class provides a converter that is able to read and write Double objects. In addition to the read and write methods that read or write Double objects this class contains readDouble and writeDouble methods that convert the Double object after reading or before writing it to its primitive double type.

Example usage (1). 

     // catch IOExceptions

     try {

         // create a byte array output stream

         ByteArrayOutputStream output = new ByteArrayOutputStream();

         // write a Double and a double value to the output stream

         DoubleConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.write(new DataOutputStream(output), new Double(2.7236512));
         DoubleConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.writeDouble(new java.io.DataOutputStream(output), 6.123853d);

         // create a byte array input stream on the output stream

         ByteArrayInputStream input = new ByteArrayInputStream(output.toByteArray());

         // read a double value and a Double from the input stream

         double d1 = DoubleConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.readDouble(new DataInputStream(input));
         Double d2 = (Double)DoubleConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.read(new DataInputStream(input));

         // print the value and the object

         System.out.println(d1);
         System.out.println(d2);

         // close the streams after use

         input.close();
         output.close();
     }
     catch (IOException ioe) {
         System.out.println("An I/O error occured.");
     }

See Also:
DataInput, DataOutput, IOException

Field Detail

DEFAULT_INSTANCE

public static final DoubleConverter DEFAULT_INSTANCE
This instance can be used for getting a default instance of DoubleConverter. It is similar to the Singleton Design Pattern (for further details see Creational Patterns, Prototype in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides) except that there are no mechanisms to avoid the creation of other instances of DoubleConverter.

SIZE

public static final int SIZE
This field contains the number of bytes needed to serialize the double value of a Double object. Because this size is predefined it must not be measured each time.
Constructor Detail

DoubleConverter

public DoubleConverter()
Sole constructor. (For invocation by subclass constructors, typically implicit.)
Method Detail

read

public Object read(DataInput dataInput,
                   Object object)
            throws IOException
Reads the double value for the specified (Double) object from the specified data input and returns the restored object.
This implementation ignores the specified object and returns a new Double object. So it does not matter when the specified object is null.
Overrides:
read in class Converter
Parameters:
dataInput - the stream to read the double value from in order to return a Double object.
object - the (Double) object to be restored. In this implementation it is ignored.
Returns:
the read Double object.
Throws:
IOException - if I/O errors occur.

readDouble

public double readDouble(DataInput dataInput)
                  throws IOException
Reads the double value from the specified data input and returns it.
This implementation uses the read method and converts the returned Double object to its primitive double type.
Parameters:
dataInput - the stream to read the double value from.
Returns:
the read double value.
Throws:
IOException - if I/O errors occur.

write

public void write(DataOutput dataOutput,
                  Object object)
           throws IOException
Writes the double value of the specified Double object to the specified data output.
This implementation calls the writeDouble method of the data output with the double value of the object.
Overrides:
write in class Converter
Parameters:
dataOutput - the stream to write the double value of the specified Double object to.
object - the Double object that double value should be written to the data output.
Throws:
IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

writeDouble

public void writeDouble(DataOutput dataOutput,
                        double d)
                 throws IOException
Writes the specified double value to the specified data output.
This implementation calls the write method with a Double object wrapping the specified double value.
Parameters:
dataOutput - the stream to write the specified double value to.
d - the double value that should be written to the data output.
Throws:
IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use a DoubleConverter. It can also be used to test the functionality of a DoubleConverter.
Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
